moves.11. Nc3 a5: To provide a safe place for the King.
moves.12. Nxe4 Qb4 13. Nc3: The idea here is to prepare to advance the pawns and restrict the Black K.
moves.13... Na6 14. O-O Re8 15. d4 Nc7: Black wants to exchange where possible.
moves.16. a3: The idea is to support a pawn storm on the K.
moves.17... Qd7 18. Ne4c5 Qc8: Black is not worried about the N moving yet because the LSB is unprotected.
moves.19. Be3 Ka7 20. Bh3: Now the discovered attack is a threat.
moves.20... Nxe6 21. Nxe6 Qb8 22. d5+: This opens up lines against the K.
moves.22... b6: Black tries to protect the K.
moves.23. dxc6 Rc8 24. c7 Rxc7: Black gives back the exchange to eliminate the dangerous pawn and N.
moves.25. Nxc7 Qxc7: Technically, material is now equal. But White retains an initiative.
moves.26. Be6: The idea was to impede Black's development. While material is technically even, White's activity (2 Bishops and 2 Rooks vs the Black Q should suffice to win easily.
moves.26... Qd6 27. Rfe1: ?? Hallucinating that the Bishop can't be taken.
moves.27... Qxe6: Now White is lost, White resigns.
